Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery little master cup; interior: black lines on rim; upper wall glazed, reserved below; exterior: lip glazed; reserved band at junction of rim and body; band at top of handle zone, which is reserved with plastic ram's head with black eyes and plastic knucklebone; rows of single dots in between; glazed black below.
Type series: Schlotzhauer Ionian Cup Type with application
Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as belonging to the South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9C. However, the curve of the shoulder and the curved junction of the rim and body suggest that the sherd might be better placed within his Type 9B group. For parallels regarding the shape and decoration, see See Berlin 3678 from Rhodes (Samos 6.1, pl.42 no. 346).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIII, no. 1)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (p. 127, no. 349)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 284, p. 113)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.760) (Phase 3)
